meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent2: He constantly belittles his coworkers in front of others.
meanings.sent3: The cat belittles the dog's attempts to catch the ball.
meanings.sent4: The storm belittles the strength of the old tree.
meanings.sent5: His harsh tone belittles the value of her hard work.

meanings.sent1: They often belittle others to make themselves feel superior.
meanings.sent2: She tends to belittle people behind their backs.
meanings.sent3: The comedian belittles his own jokes before telling them.
meanings.sent4: The gossip belittles the reputation of the town's mayor.
meanings.sent5: His sarcastic tone belittles the efforts of the volunteers.
